Pre-Game Insights: Both teams showed fearlessness and freedom in batting in the first T20I.
Nicholas Pooran and Tilak Varma showcased powerful hitting.
Bowlers shone the brightest, despite the eye-catching hitters.
West Indies last beat India in successive T20Is in 2016.
If Shepherd keeps his current form, he will likely be a key player for West Indies in the T20 World Cup.
Hardik Pandya's recent form in middle overs is underwhelming.
West Indies would not want to tinker with their winning combination.
India might play Yashasvi Jaiswal as a batter to shorten their tail.
Two of the last five T20Is at Providence Stadium have been washed out.
Kuldeep Yadav has an average less than 15 and an economy rate under seven among players with 40 wickets.
Kyle Mayers averages only 20.81 as an opener in T20Is.
No member from the visitors' playing XI in the 2019 T20I at Providence is part of the current squad.
West Indies captain Rovman Powell emphasizes the importance of batting spin in middle overs.
Arshdeep Singh praises Tilak Varma's attacking shots and believes he will be a key player in the future.
